name: Black Sand Drift
description: For over 300 years, the five planets of the Kotiro galaxy have struggled under the heavy hand of maniacal, mechanical bots called Spiral. As the metallic army's relentless pursuit of the resource Black Sand begins ramping up exponentially, a few brave heroes decide to fight back.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP and above Processor: 1.0 Ghz Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 256MB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 260 MB available space

reviews.review_text: this game is INFURIATING. first of all, the art is horrendous -- the drawn character art looks like it was drawn by someone who died halfway through and the ingame sprites are all ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ovals and lazy vector art that i could, for real, legitimately, actually do better than. so how is the game? it is ALSO bad! i hope you like tediously fighting a single enemy type thousands of times in a single level because the way to progress to the next is simply to kill enough for it to let you do so. don't worry though hbecause you can also cheat because they knew their game was so irredeemably unenjoyable that they put in a way to skip throgh it. wow  also the music is baffling. completely inexplicable game with zero redeeming qualities.
